6-science-earth-space-plate-tectonics.title: Plate Tectonics Baseline Quiz
6-science-earth-space-plate-tectonics.description: Quick pulse-check on prior knowledge of tectonic processes before students dive into investigations.

questions.prompt: Which layer of Earth consists of solid rock plates that move over the asthenosphere?

options.feedback: Tectonic plates are sections of the lithosphere.

questions.explanation: The lithosphere is Earth’s rigid outer shell made of the crust and upper mantle.

questions.prompt: Which evidence best supports the theory that continents were once connected?

options.text: Similar climate zones exist on different continents today.
Identical fossils are found on continents separated by oceans.
options.feedback: Matching fossils across oceans provide strong evidence of continental drift.

questions.explanation: Identical fossils on distant continents indicate those land masses were once connected.

questions.prompt: What is most likely happening at a convergent plate boundary between an oceanic and continental plate?

options.text: New crust is forming as magma rises.
The plates slide past each other without vertical movement.
The oceanic plate subducts beneath the continental plate.
options.feedback: Denser oceanic crust dives beneath continental crust, forming trenches and volcanoes.

options.text: Both plates break apart forming a rift valley.

questions.explanation: Convergent plate boundaries with oceanic-continental interaction typically result in subduction.

6-mathematics-number-operations-ratios-p.title: Ratios & Proportions Warm-Up
6-mathematics-number-operations-ratios-p.description: Baseline check on ratio representations to personalize practice sets.

questions.prompt: The ratio of cats to dogs in a shelter is 3 to 5. Which statement correctly describes this ratio?

options.text: For every 3 cats there are 5 dogs.
options.feedback: Ratios compare quantities in order; 3 cats correspond with 5 dogs.

options.text: There are 8 more dogs than cats.
For every 5 cats there are 3 dogs.
There are 3 cats and 5 dogs total.

questions.explanation: Ratios use the order of numbers to describe relationships.

questions.prompt: A smoothie recipe uses 2 cups of strawberries for every 3 cups of yogurt. How many cups of strawberries are needed with 9 cups of yogurt?

options.feedback: Multiply both parts of the ratio by 3 to maintain the proportion.

questions.explanation: The ratio 2:3 scales to 6:9 when multiplied by 3.

questions.prompt: A car travels 180 miles on 6 gallons of gas. What is the unit rate in miles per gallon?

options.feedback: Compute 180 ÷ 6 to find 30 miles per gallon.

questions.explanation: Divide total miles by gallons (180 ÷ 6) to obtain the 30 mpg unit rate.
